repository.corpname: NYU Abu Dhabi, Archives and Special Collections

did.unittitle: NYU Abu Dhabi Art Gallery Collection

physdesc.extent: in 1 half document box and 4 legal size document boxes

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Materials have been donated from the Art Gallery Team, and have also been acquired by NYUAD community members who have donated copies of exhibition publications, as well as items acquired by NYUAD Library archivists for integration into the University Archives.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Established in 2014, The NYU Abu Dhabi (NYUAD) Art Gallery is the Gulf's first and only university gallery with a program of scholarly and experimental museum exhibitions. The program seeks to map new territories and ideas through presenting exhibitions by internationally established artists, curators, and scholars at its main space. Its auxiliary venue, the Project Space, is an exhibition laboratory for the university community, and for emerging artists and curators. Situated within NYU Abu Dhabi, the community of which hails from over 115 countries, The Art Gallery organizes free public programs and guided tours in conjunction with its groundbreaking exhibitions. It also produces scholarly publications, which are a core part of its curatorial frame and reflect its academic mission. Collectively, with the Gallery's Reading Room, these welcoming, intimate spaces open up artistic opportunities and initiate regional and international dialogue.

The Galleries Department oversees all exhibition activity on campus, including the main gallery (for museum exhibitions), the Project Space (for experimental projects), and the Christo Award (for emerging UAE artists).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The NYU Abu Dhabi Art Gallery Collection is an accumulating collection of publications and ephemera by and about the Art Gallery. Primarily comprised of exhibition catalogs and research publications in print, the collection includes a comprehensive set of copies produced for each exhibition. In most cases, this will be an exhibition program, curatorial catalog, youth guide, and any book project associated with the exhibition. Independent book projects also form part of the collection.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Related collections include the NYU Abu Dhabi Arts Center collection, NYUAD Publications and Ephemera, the Woodman Taylor Collection, and the Abby Weed Grey Papers.
